_header: Weeping and wailing care and other sorrow
_description: Geoffrey Chaucer, the Merchant’s Prologue of the Canterbury Tales — 32 lines in couplets.

BodArcSelB14.First Lines:
Weping & wayling care & other soroweI knowe I now on even
                    & on morowe…
BodArcSelB14.Last Lines:
…gladly qoud he but of myn owne sorefor hevy herte I telle may
                    no more
BodArcSelB14.Attributed Title:
…And / next folwith the Marchauntis prolog (f. 114v); the
                    prolog (RT); Here endith the Marchauntis prolog… (f. 115)

Bod686.First Lines:
Wepyng and waillyng care and oþer sorowI koow you on eve and
                    on morow…
Bod686.Last Lines:
…Gladly quod he but of myne owne soreffor sory herte I telle
                    may namore

OxfChrCh152.First Lines:
Wepyng and waylynge care and other sorweI know I nough on eue &

OxfChrCh152.Last Lines:

                    may no more

                    bothe even & ek amorowe…
OxfNew314.Last Lines:
…Gladli quod he but of myn owen soreffor sori herte I telle
                    may no more
OxfNew314.Attributed Title:
…Begynnynge of the Marchauntis Prolog (f. 79v); Here
                    endith the prolog… (f. 80)

OxfTri49.First Lines:
weping and wailyng care and othir sorweI knowe I nowe att euyn and
                    eke att morwe…
OxfTri49.Last Lines:
…Gladly quoth he but of myne owne soreffor sory herte I may
                    telle no more

BLAdd35286.First Lines:
Wepyng and wailyng care and other sorweI know ynow on euen and on
                    morwe…

                    his lyue…

                    107v)

BLHar7333.First Lines:
WEping and wayling care and oþere soroweKnow I now bothe evin
                    & Eke on morowe…
BLHar7333.Last Lines:
…Gladly quod he but of myn owne soreFor sory herte I tel may
                    no more

BLHar7334.First Lines:

                    na more

BLHar7335.First Lines:
…Wifles hath ben thogh that men wolde hym ryueVn to the herte
                    ne koude in no manere…
BLHar7335.Last Lines:
…Gladly quod he but of myn owne soreffor sori hert y telle may
                    no more

BLRoy17Dxv.First Lines:
WEpenge waylenge care & other sorroweI knowe ynoughe boþe
                    on evene & eke on Morowe…
BLRoy17Dxv.Last Lines:
…Gladely quod he of myne owne soreffor sorye herte I telle may
                    no more
BLRoy17Dxv.Attributed Title:

LonPhys388.First Lines:
WEPyng and wailyng and other care and soroweI know I nough bothe
                    eve and morow…
LonPhys388.Last Lines:
…Gladly quod he of myn awne soreffor sory I tel may
                    nomore
LonPhys388.Note:
The Merchant’s Prologue, in a different ink than the
                    preceding folios. The verso holds only the last four lines (IV.1241-44) and the
                    rubric, ‘Explicit prologus Incipit ffabula’, with the rest
                    left blank. Shipman’s Tale begins on the following
                    recto.

PUL100.First Lines:
WEpying and weylyng care and othir sorowyngI knowe I nowȝe
                    both evyn & morowe…
PUL100.Last Lines:
…Gladly quod he but of myn own soreffor sory hert I tel may
                    not more
PUL100.Attributed Title:
…And here begynnyth the Marchaunte his prolog (f. 60v);
                    Here endith the Prologg… (f. 61)

HunEL26C9.First Lines:

                    may namoore

                    (RT)
